definition: causing dejection, any of numerous small butterflies of the family Lycaenidae, to turn blue
details:
adjective
- causing dejection
= example: causing dejection
= synonyms: dark
- of the color intermediate between green and violet
= synonyms: bluish
- characterized by profanity or cursing
= synonyms: blasphemous, profane
- filled with melancholy and despondency
= synonyms: low
- belonging to or characteristic of the nobility or aristocracy
= synonyms: gentle, aristocratic, aristocratical, blue-blooded, patrician
- used to signify the Union forces in the American Civil War (who wore blue uniforms)
= example: used to signify the Union forces in the American Civil War (who wore blue uniforms)
- suggestive of sexual impropriety
= example: suggestive of sexual impropriety
= synonyms: gamy
- morally rigorous and strict
= synonyms: puritanic, puritanical
noun
- any of numerous small butterflies of the family Lycaenidae
- the sodium salt of amobarbital that is used as a barbiturate
= synonyms: amobarbital sodium, blue angel, blue devil
- blue clothing
= example: blue clothing
- blue color or pigment
= synonyms: blueness
- any organization or party whose uniforms or badges are blue
= example: any organization or party whose uniforms or badges are blue
- the sky as viewed during daylight
= example: the sky as viewed during daylight
= synonyms: blue sky, blue air
- used to whiten laundry or hair or give it a bluish tinge
= synonyms: bluing, blueing
verb
- to turn blue
= example: to turn blue
